sentences.en: A tall man has to stoop to get through the low door - way.
sentences.cn: 高个子不得不弯腰才能穿过这个低矮的门洞.

sentences.en: Dave stooped down to tie his shoes.
He had a long , thin body and the scholar's stoop.
sentences.cn: 他身材瘦长并且象学者一样弯腰驼背.

sentences.en: He has to stoop to get through the tunnel.
He is too lofty to stoop to vulgar intrigue.
sentences.cn: 他的清高使他还不至于屈就卑俗的勾当.

sentences.en: He used to stoop, but he did exercises to make his shoulders straight.
sentences.cn: 他过去驼背, 但他坚持锻炼,现在已腰板挺直了.

sentences.en: He was a tall, thin fellow with a slight stoop.
sentences.cn: 他是个瘦高个儿，有点驼背。

sentences.en: He'd stoop to anything, ie He has no moral standards.
sentences.cn: 他无论多麽不道德的事都干得出来.

sentences.en: He's beginning to stoop with age, ie as he gets older.
sentences.cn: 他年事渐高,背也开始变驼了.

sentences.en: I refuse to stoop to such bullying tactics.
sentences.cn: 我拒绝下作到使用这种霸道手段.

sentences.en: I think he'd never stoop to stealing.
sentences.cn: 我认为他不至堕落到偷窃的地步.

sentences.en: It degrades to stoop -- it is glorious to look up.
sentences.cn: 卑躬屈膝是卑鄙的, -- 敢于趾高气扬才是光荣.

sentences.en: It pains me to stoop down.
Mr Hamilton was an odd, quiet man who walked with a stoop.
sentences.cn: 汉密尔顿先生是个怪人，不爱说话，走路时弓着背。

sentences.en: My uncle walks with a stoop.
They stood together on the stoop and rang the bell.
sentences.cn: 他们一起站在门廊上按响了门铃。

sentences.en: They will stoop to every low-down trick.
sentences.cn: 他们什么卑劣的手段都使得出来。

sentences.en: We had to stoop to pass through the low entrance.
sentences.cn: 我们得弯腰通过那低矮的入口。

trans.tran_en: if you have a stoop, your shoulders are bent forward
to bend your body forward and down
to bend your body forward and down
to bend your body forward and down

trans.tran_cn: 弯腰，俯身；屈从，堕落，沦为
trans.tran_en: to bend your body forward and down
